result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 02/12/16: Court orders JOC be amended to reflect 1 year probation rather than 2 years.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge

--No presence at Emanda or Eureka Taylor's places of residence
--No contact with Emanda and Eureka Taylor. Violation of no contact is an independent misdemeanor charge
--No possession of any dangerous weapon
--Complete certified Batterers' Intervention Programming
--No acts/threats of violence
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Turner to 12 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, to commence forthwith

The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber/work release without further process.

All outstanding obligations are to be converted to civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:03am [MA]
Defendant Michael J Turner in court, in custody with Attorney Jordan Lippert.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel verifies receipt of revocation order and warrant
--ADA Hall makes factual corrections to charge history

The Court and Counsel discuss maximum sentence and prison sentence; the Court finds that state prison is not an option due to the maximum confinement law.
The Court and Counsel review State v. Denter

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Mr. Turner to 12 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, to commence forthwith
The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber/work release without further process.

All outstanding obligations are to be converted to civil judgment.

134 days sentence credit 
recess:9:51am
Clerk's response to defendant's request for copies
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
COC's Response to Defendant's request for copies
from Defendant requesting copies of JOC
Sent to Defendant (1)DOC letter with Court's Order re: Amending JOC (2)Amended JOC//sent to LKA
Court orders COC to issue amended JOC with 1 year probation rather than 2 years. cc: all w/amended JOC
to Surety - per 1/5/16 court order. (Verified her address via phone call)
from DOC Records requesting clarification of the probationary term
with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at 11:04 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Michael J Turner in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS charge to Battery while armed, contrary to sec. 940.19(1), 939.63(1)(a) a Class A misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2  years, with conditions:
--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--No presence at Emanda or Eureka Taylor's places of residence
--No contact with Emanda and Eureka Taylor. Violation of no contact is an independent misdemeanor charge
--No possession of any dangerous weapon
--Complete certified Batterers' Intervention Programming
--No acts/threats of violence
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge
APPLY CASH BOND - REMAINDER TO BE RETURNED TO SURETY

Days credit for time already served: 45 days
Recess: 11:22 am
Defendant's Objection to Admission of Medical Records
Sent to Defendant (1)NOH for FSSC on 1/5/16 (2)Scheduling Order (3)NOH for 1/11/16 Jury Trial//Defendant in Custody at JCJ
Notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant
States motion to impeach the defendant with prior convictions/adjudications
States notice of intent to admit medical reports without the records custodian
Sent to Defendant at Jefferson County Jail (1)NOH for 1/5/16 FSSC (2)Scheduling Order (3)NOH for 1/11/16 Jury Trial//Defendant no longer in Custody
Sent to Jefferson County Jail (1)NOH for 1/5/16 FSSC (2)NOH for 1/11/16 Jury Trial//Defendant no longer in Custody

Case called at 2:16pm [mo]
Defendant Michael J Turner in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Lippert indicates a resolution has not been met, requests a Jury Trial be scheduled
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling; two day trial needed due to amount of witnesses.
recess: 2:18pm

NEXT: (1) FSSC on 1/5/16 at 10:30am (2) Jury Trial on 1/11/16 and/or 1/12/16 at 8:30am
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 10/1/15

Case called at 2:10 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Michael Onheiber presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Michael J Turner in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jordan Lippert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Defendant Stands Mute; Plea of "not guilty" entered on Defendant's behalf
Recess: 2:14 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 9/23/15 at 3:40 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 10/23/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices

Case called at 2:09pm [mo]
[Commissioner Onheiber presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Michael J Turner in court, in custody with Attorney Jordan Lippert.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr. Turner waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

ADA Hall submits Information to the Court. Atty. Lippert waives the reading of the Information 


On the Defense's Motion to Modify Bond:
--Arguments in favor given by Atty. Lippert
--Arguments against given by ADA Hall
--The Court inquires of ADA Hall the bond arguments given at the Initial Appearance
--Further argument given by Atty. Lippert
--The Court inquires of Atty. Lippert if Milwaukee Co. cases with the caption 'Michael J Turner' are THIS Michael J Turner as there was some confusion at the Initial Appearance; Atty. Lippert indicates that to his best knowledge those cases belong to THIS Michael J Turner. 
--The Court denies the Defense's Motion to Modify Bond; gives basis

recess: 2:28pm 


NEXT:  Arraignment on 9/4/15 at 2:00pm (will be held in Branch 2)
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail

Case called at 1:19-pm. [mo]
[Commissioner Onheiber presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Michael J Turner appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Turner is eligible for PD representation.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are NOT waived by Defense

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $1,000  CASH bond, with conditions:
--No direct or indirect contact with Emanda Taylor
--No direct or indirect contact with Evreka Taylor
--No presence at any place occupied by Emanda Taylor
--No acts or threats of violence

recess 1:35  pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 8/27/15 at 2:00pm (Branch II Before Commissioner Onheiber) (time limits apply)
